article.Heading: Budget 2017: Safety prime for Railways; mulling safety cess on tickets: Srcs
article.Summary: Of the total Rs 55,000 crore alotted to the railways this Budget, Rs 15,000 crore will be kept aside for the safety fund. The fund will be used to renew tracks and bridges, for manpower training and for track inspections.
article.Body:
With three big rail accidents in the last two months, the Indian Railways is facing the heat. The accidents have raised serious questions about the lack of thrust on improving safety.

In a bid to correct this perception, the government is going to allocate the highest ever resources to the railways and, a meaningful portion of which will be spent on safety, say sources.

Of the total Rs 55,000 crore alotted to the railways this Budget, Rs 15,000 crore will be kept aside for the safety fund. The fund will be used to renew tracks and bridges, for manpower training and for track inspections.

The Indian Railways is also considering a 'Safety Cess' on tickets.
